instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no image or backlight. No liquid damage. Had a tiny green spot by <RESISTOR>R8534</RESISTOR> but it still measures the way it should.

When powering on the white hard drive led will blink 5 times, it will then chime but no video on internal or external. Replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> as usual on these but this time it didn't resolve the issue. Gave GPU a light re flow as well but no difference.

On <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> with updated cap im getting 1.5V What to check next or is this just dead GPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: With battery connected I no longer get 5 blinking lights from sleep indicator but it is still chiming with no image

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Looks like bad GPU.
You can try to reflow <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>, just in case...
